a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Global warming: Contributions to the change in global mean surface
This is shown as a country or region's share of the global mean surface temperature change as a result of its cumulative
emissions of three gases â€“ carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide.
Note: Cooling effects of sulphur dioxide and aerosols are not included â€“ this means the net impact for some countries can be negative.
Methane and nitrous oxide are included using the GWP* approach.
